Acerca del empleo
Principal Data Scientist (m/w/d)

We are Aily Labs, a start-up founded in Spring 2020 and we are now already a team of +120 super motivated ML Engineers, data scientists and developers.

At Aily, one of our passions is to innovate and we differentiate ourselves from other companies in the way we operate. Besides creating beautiful software products, we also work with what we call ‚ÄúLabs‚Äù. In our labs, we are developing proofs of concept in direct collaboration with our clients. We are pushing the boundaries of AI, using Speech2Text, Probabilistic Clustering, time series forecasting, what-if simulations, and many more. Want to join the fun of innovating great new solutions?

Role

If you have a passion for data and technology and want to join a crew of sharp analytical minds, then this may be the right opportunity for you. As a Principal data scientist, you will get a chance to take part lead the development of features of our AI product and perform the following tasks:

¬∑ Project lead of multiple initiatives (laboratories and product features)
¬∑ Define data science modeling strategy and advise/revise coding approach
¬∑ Lead of multidisciplinary teams of data scientists and developers
¬∑ Define team priorities
¬∑ Lead daily stand-up meetings of your team and sprint planning sessions
¬∑ Manage team capacity and agree project scopes
¬∑ Ultimate responsible and QA of features and deliverables
¬∑ Resolve conflicts across the functions of the team (DevOps/AI/DB/FE/BE‚Ä¶)
¬∑ Interact with our clients and understand their challenges, their data, and their needs


Qualifications / Experience

¬∑ >6 years of experience in data science
¬∑ >4 years' experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL). Including package building, object-oriented programming. Bonus: APIs, AWS Lambda, Step functions, ‚Ä¶
¬∑ >3 years' experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)
¬∑ Experience leading multiple projects and multiple teams

¬∑ Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience

What sets us apart?
¬∑ We are an internationally diverse team that supports one another

¬∑ We enjoy new technologies and love to learn new things and grow with them

¬∑ Competitive salary

Acerca del empleo
What¬¥s the role?

The Sr. DS will support in building and operationalizing the Fintech technology platform vision and support the set-up of the Lend vehicles driving value through creation of credit scoring portal, data manipulation to drive lead generation, designing the lend customer journey and building sustainable platforms for continue expansion of airtime lending product. This role will be instrumental in driving growth and implementing Fintech strategies across Liberty Latin America.

How you will contribute?

Support CEO & COO in execution of key data science aspects of the Fintech agenda
Creates, develops and improves data science credit scoring models, algorithms and AI models according to the business roadmap
In early stages drive modelling directly as required ahead of building a full team

Actively looks for further data sharing partnerships and data sources as opportunities to expand the company‚Äôs footprint and coverage
Collaborates with cross-functional teams and developers based locally and international to achieve tactical and strategic business goals while bringing innovation through data
Participates actively and support the innovation and product creation by providing expertise and solutions to cater to the needed output for the business
Drives value and lead expertise in the research, formulation and in developing data-informed resolutions to create new data and analytics products focusing on revenue growth vis-√†-vis company‚Äôs competitive advantage.
Develops policies, procedures and best practices for the collection, use, and analysis of data to build and sustain a data-informed decision-making products and customer journeys
Develops replicable structures via creation of expansion standards and education of wider team members, board and shareholders
Develops collaborative working relationships within the organization and provide analytics-driven contracting guidance to cross-functional leaders while promoting the value of world-class analytics
To establish and maintain strong relations with existing and potential business partners in data analytics and data science.
Drives and guide the collaboration of interdisciplinary initiatives to ensure the data warehousing and reporting supports the analytics to enable Management to make data driven business decisions.
Mentors, coaches and develops a team that provides advanced analytics support and is capable of catering multiple markets
Manage a team of data scientists, machine learning engineers and big data specialists
Visualize data and create reports

What do you need?

8 years of project management experience preferably in fintech start-ups

Knowledge of link between Fintech & Telecom
Proven success working in an innovative environment and in the development of digital fintech products and services

MBA or other advanced degree preferred; undergraduate degree in related discipline required

Acerca del empleo
ADP is hiring a Senior Insights Data Scientist.
Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets in the US excite you?
Are you inspired by transformation and making an impact on the lives of millions of people every day?
Are you a technologist first and foremost who approaches every problem wearing that hat while going out of your way to champion creativity and build diverse, productive, and engaged teams?
Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what's next?

In this role, you'll acquire, clean, and analyze large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements. It's more than digits and dials - you're making huge decisions that impact millions of customers.

Every day you'll work with multiple stakeholders both technical and business oriented and help them bridge the gap. You will work on helping them to understand what their biggest opportunities are and how to properly measure them. You'll work with your team to provide, interpret, and predict necessary metrics for decision-making. You'll code with machine learning tools like Python, R, and Scala to synthesize millions of data sets into actionable insights that answer all kinds of business needs and then use Tableau for data visualization.

To thrive in this career, you should know how to identify errors and reactively fix them. You'll need to have some formal education in quantitative analytics and know design patterns and data structures. You understand machine learning modelling and know how and when to apply it. You will defining the goals of your team making sure they are aligned with the business requirements, vision and strategy. But given the scale of our data sets and the complex problems we give you to solve, you will stay challenged and engaged with years of exciting projects ahead--all while growing your skills and progressing in a rewarding career.

Like what you see? Apply now!

A little about ADP: We are a global leader in HR technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, HR, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as a global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc¬Æ Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos

What You'll Do

Here's what you can expect on a typical day in the life of an Insights Data Scientist at ADP.
Metrics and KPIs. You'll be defining metrics and KPIs together with the Data Science Directors to measure the success of our Programs.
Align with business needs. Bridging the gap between technical and business needs. You'll be collaborating with our Product Managers to understand what are they trying to solve.
Guiding the team: your analyses will be the cornerstone for our actions, they will give us evidence on what to do next and which are the biggest areas of opportunity.
Building products together. You will be part of a high performance team of Data Scientists and you will be developing our solutions as a member of the team.
A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills and experience to do the job. To be successful in this role, you'll have 3-5 years of experience in the same or similar role.

To Succeed In This Role
A Bachelor Degree or Equivalent.
Excellent SQL skills
Scripting language, preferably Python
Data visualization tools, preferably Tableau
Experience in building Machine Learning models
It's even better if you have knowledge on distributed computing tools sch as Hadoop, Hive or Spark.
You'll Love Working Here Because You Can
Have courageous team collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to find the best solution.
Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity.
Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes.
Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to leading change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft.
Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation.
Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions.
What are you waiting for? Apply today!

Find out why people come to ADP and why they stay: https://youtu.be/ODb8lxBrxrY

(ADA version: https://youtu.be/IQjUCA8SOoA )

Explore our COVID-19 page https://tech.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

job_title: Data Analyst, Data & Analytics ‚Äì IKEA Madrid
description:
Acerca del empleo
Who We Are

Chartboost is the leading in-app monetization and programmatic advertising platform. We reach a global audience of over 700 million monthly active users and process over 2.7 trillion monthly advertising auctions. The Chartboost SDK is one the most widely integrated mobile ad SDKs and through the Chartboost Exchange, Ad Network, DSP and other services, we empower mobile app developers to build businesses, while connecting advertisers to highly engaged audiences.

We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our iOS team, one of the most exciting and important products within Chartboost. The system powering this product must deal with 100,000‚Äôs of requests per second and presents unique data science challenges. The bidder uses a variety of batch and real-time signals to power decision making in real-time. The iOS team will be in charge of designing and implementing solutions for privacy preserving advertisements that would respect the privacy of our users.

Impact You Will Make

Design and test predictive models and control algorithms at large scale that control real money and target specific financial goals
Maintain, tune, and enhance production models written with Python and Scala
Propose and engineer new model features using Python, SQL and Scala to improve KPIs
Develop and refine best practices for data processing, experimentation, monitoring, debugging, and analyzing data pipelines

Who You Are

BS degree in Engineering, Statistics, Math, Economics, Machine Learning or Computer Science
2 years of practical experience in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, and sound understanding of Data Science and Machine Learning principles
Experience with continuously-deployed and frequently-retrained production ML models or ETL pipelines for large and/or fast data
Strong data visualization and manipulation skills: you are able to distill a clear picture from disparate data sources reflecting a complex business
Intermediate Python proficiency for scripting and model prototyping; proficient with SQL and familiar with Scala

The Following Experience Would Be a Plus

Ad Tech or Mobile Game Industry

Perks

Competitive salary with bonuses
Flexible schedule based on core hours and the possibility of working remotely
Private health insurance
Life insurance
Optical complement for glasses or contact lenses.
Company sponsored lunch
English/Spanish lessons and/or other investments in your professional development
Gym membership
Transportation reimbursement
Healthy snacks, and coffee in our cool office in the center of Barcelona
23 days of paid time off per year
15 paid holidays per year
Team building events

More About Us

We are proud of the product we've built and appreciate the impact it has on other people's businesses and lives. We want to be surrounded by people who are always finding opportunities to try something new and grow. We love data and anything that helps drive intelligent decisions and always design with the user in mind. Sounds like a fit? Join us, and be part of the team that will change the future of mobile gaming!

We are an equal opportunity employer ‚Äî we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and make our hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Acerca del empleo
Role: Desk Quant Analyst, Madrid
Squarepoint is a global investment management firm that utilizes a diversified portfolio of systematic and quantitative strategies across financial markets that seeks to achieve high quality, uncorrelated returns for our clients. We have deep expertise in trading, technology and operations and attribute our success to rigorous scientific research. As a technology and data-driven firm, we design and build our own cutting-edge systems, from high performance trading platforms to large scale data analysis and compute farms. With offices around the globe, we emphasize true, global collaboration by aligning our investment, technology and operations teams functionally around the world.
Overview of Desk Quant Analyst Position:
Maintain and upgrade the codebase and configuration of strategies within the firm‚Äôs automated trading framework.
Manage large datasets used in both research and production environments.
Perform live as well as historical monitoring of trading activities. For instance, do some post-trade analysis or production reconciliation.
Work in close collaboration with quant researchers and traders to understand the constantly evolving needs of the trading desks.
Typical Day of Desk Quant Analyst:
Before market open, check that all required data and related processes are ready for the trading day.
During market hours, sporadically monitor behavior and performance of strategies.
Work on various longer-term projects required for expanding our systematic trading activities and ensuring their robustness.
Skill Set Required For Position:
Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical subject.
Programming proficiency with at least one major programming or scripting language (e.g. C++, Java, Python).
Great attention to details.
Strong communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues across multiple regions.
Ability to work well under pressure.
Candidates for the Singapore office: Employment Pass will not be sponsored for this role.
Additional Desirable Qualifications:
Knowledge of Q/KDB+.
Knowledge of Linux and Bash.
Advanced quantitative skills.

Please submit your application in English language only.

Acerca del empleo
Our Flexible Solutions (FSP) department is a well-established, global team within Labcorp Drug Development, with highly skilled and dedicated employees based across APAC, EMEA and the Americas. Our colleagues in FSPx work exclusively for one of our renowned key clients in the pharmaceutical / biotech industry.

Our highly successful Biometrics business unit within FSPx is growing continuously; therefore we are now looking for several Graduate Biostatisticians to join our team in September 2023, in any of the following locations:
Milan, Italy
Madrid, Spain
Barcelona, Spain
Munich, Germany
If you are finishing your education before September 2023, enjoy programming and solving riddles, have a talent for logical thinking and a keen eye for detail, and are looking for an entry level position that will teach you all the necessary skills for a rewarding and successful biostatistics career in a genuinely impactful industry, this is an excellent opportunity!

What else can you expect from us?
Rewarding and meaningful work in an established, diverse, highly profitable and respected global company
A hybrid work model, where you will be working both in your nearest Labcorp office and from home ‚Äì offering you a lot of flexibility as well as a genuine work life balance
An intensive and comprehensive 6-months training curriculum, developed and delivered by Labcorp‚Äôs biostatistics experts, that is designed to jumpstart your programming career in clinical research
A permanent employment contract with Labcorp Drug Development
Highly competitive compensation packages
Excellent training and career development opportunities, a transparent, continuous feedback culture, and strictly merit-based career progression models for both aspiring people managers and subject matter experts
Strong support from your Labcorp Line Manager and your team, as well as from more than 20,000 Labcorp Drug Development colleagues worldwide
Your Role
Conduct overall statistical review of TFLs for medium complexity studies prior to client delivery.
Preparation of Statistical Analysis Plans (including mock TFL shells) for simple and medium complexity studies under the supervision of senior statistical staff.
Perform statistical analysis for medium complexity studies.
Review Clinical Report Form and other study specific specifications and plans.
Provide statistical input and review of the Clinical Study Report for simple studies.
Generation and review of randomization schedules from provided specifications under the supervision of senior statistical staff
Your Profile
Degree in a relevant field such as statistics, medical statistics, biostatistics, computer sciences, data science, etc.
First programming experience in SAS, R, Python, C++, SQL, etc. is nice to have, but no must
Strong organizational and communication skills
A collaborative work style, good problem solving skills, and the ability to learn new systems and flourish in an evolving technical environment
Business fluency in English (B2 or above) is a must
Labcorp Is Proud To Be An Equal Opportunity Employer

As an EOE/AA employer, Labcorp strives for diversity and inclusion in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications of the individual and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy or other medical conditions/needs), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. We encourage all to apply.

For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, please see our Privacy Statement.

Acerca del empleo
Who we are

The Workshop is a tech company that develops intuitive software for the online gaming industry. Our motto is to move ‚ÄúFearlessly Forward‚Äù together. Cooperative innovation is at the center of everything we do ‚Äì from our games, new products and technologies, to how we collaborate and share inspiration with one another.


Your mission

You will work closely with Casino & Poker stakeholders and combine your expertise in data, analytics and statistics with your knowledge of casino & poker to ensure our overall product and business strategies are firmly data driven. You will work with large amounts of transitional data & web data to provide a comprehensive view of our Casino & Poker performance for internal stakeholders. Your deliverables will include analysis, insights, and recommendations on commercial performance, impact of new releases, game configuration & platform stability and many other areas.

You will be a part of our Analytics team, who are responsible for driving insight into the performance of our digital gaming products. Their analytics drives all of TWS‚Äôs decision-making, informs product & feature strategies, and delivers detailed critiques of product feature performance. You will be responsible for major analytics and reporting deliverables and will work closely with senior Casino and Analytics leadership. This position may require limited international travel.


What you'll do

Take ownership of the end-to-end delivery of Casino & Poker Analytics requests, including introducing and instilling data best practice, integrating new data sources, visualizing data and presenting outputs.
Actively provide feedback on product performance/functionality and make thoughtful recommendations on ways to improve Casino & Poker products and influence the roadmap.
Collaborate with Casino & Poker leadership to clearly understand their major business problems and help resolve them using data & analytics.
Develop and implement new KPIs for monitoring business & feature success.
Contribute to requirements for data architecture to create a robust and long-term data solution based on the reporting needs.
Use data queries (SQL), statistical analysis (Python) and visualization (Tableau) to structure, analyze and report on performance.
Participate in projects outside the core area, connecting to new and unexplored datasets, based on the overall needs of the organization.


What you'll bring

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
Have experience/keen interest in gaming, poker, casino or sports betting.
Advanced knowledge of statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualization best practices.
Be a driven learner, capable of identifying your own areas of self-development and then leveraging the team‚Äôs expertise to build your analytical knowledge and skills.
Have proven experience of understanding and solving business problems.
Be an experienced communicator, able to communicate complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Proficient in Tableau, Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Experience with SQL and relational databases.
Data manipulation and analysis skills.
Experience with Python.


Nice to have

Experience in multi-channel analytics, connecting to a variety of data sources with different data quality availability.


What's in it for you

Inspiring and fulfilling work at an innovative and values-driven company creating cutting-edge tech.
Attractive salary and customisable benefits package.
Contemporary and accessible office environments with a range of workplace perks.
Six weeks‚Äô paid leave for every four years of service.
Relocation package for you and your family including soft-landing package services to help you settle in (applicable in Spain, if you are moving from a different city/country).
Being part of a team with a forward-looking, international mindset and agile working practices
A friendly, inclusive and multicultural environment (we are made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking almost 30 languages).
Wellbeing programmes, learning and personal growth opportunities.
A range of employee events throughout the year, including team building activities, Learning Labs, Hackathons and Designathons.
Opportunities to shape the tech community within and outside of the company, through mentoring and knowledge-sharing.

You will align the reporting with the global best practice, reports and work with the local teams to ensure all the data is agreed and aligned. Acerca del empleo
Data Engineers, you are very welcome!

Full remote within Spain or Barcelona, Spain

At Qualifyze, we help pharmaceutical companies to guarantee that the medicines, pills, and other medical treatments that we all take to feel better are top quality and safe for us. We do that by regularly qualifying pharmaceutical suppliers collecting, processing, and monitoring supply chain information (production, logistics, quality, etc.). With that information, our customers and the overall industry can spot areas of improvement, potential risks, or new business opportunities.
Thereby we not only contribute to greater supply chain transparency, but also to increased patient safety.
Following solid traction, since our go-live in 2019, we are now scaling our business model. We are backed by top-tier VCs and business angels and are looking to grow our team of 40 in our two offices in Frankfurt and Barcelona. Reach out to us if you want to take a vital role in transforming supplier qualification in pharma and other industries.

The Qualifyze Product, Tech and Data team is responsible for:
‚ÄúBuilding the Right Thing‚Äù: Discover the right customer problems to solve and define the scalable solutions that are highly profitable and future proof
‚ÄúBuilding the Thing Right‚Äù: Building such solutions with the right amount of technology that guarantees low cost of maintenance, high speed of delivery, and high quality.

The Data & CRM team is responsible for extracting, transforming, and loading data from different sources in the company (digital platform, CRM, finance, billing, etc.) to transform it into accessible and useful information. That way, the team can help in operations, tactics, and strategic decisions.

We love people‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶who are pragmatic and optimistic. People who don‚Äôt see problems, but solutions. People who do whatever is necessary to get things done no matter roles, reporting lines, politics, etc. People who are service-oriented, committed, and make things happen. People who don‚Äôt blame but find ways of improving. People who feel passionate about teaching and learning. People who want to have fun, learn, and share while being challenged. People who love software development and know about it.

Challenge
The main challenge in the Data area is to create a rock-solid automatization of the ETL processes, and guarantee consistency between the sources. We have already some processes in place, but we need to raise the bar. For that, we work with multiple technologies like Make, Zapier, GCE, AWS, Redshift, Glue, etc.

Tasks
Understanding the data needs of the company and planning along with the analysts how these needs are going to be translated into solid data structures
Writing the required ETLs from scratch to help us build an effective Data Warehouse
Maintaining the ETLs and assuring that daily/weekly executions run smoothly and without errors
Managing the different resources used for writing, running, and maintaining our ETLs
Establishing sanity checks to catch data anomalies in the ETLs as early as possible
Constantly improving our data structures

Job requirements

About you
Experience writing ETL processes in AWS Glue or similar, S3 & Redshift
Preferable knowledge of Python (however Java/Scala could also work)
Experience with ETL additional tooling like Pyspark or similar
Very good knowledge of SQL
Professional Fluent English
Bonus points
Experience in AWS basic management (IAM, roles, groups, etc.)
Writing ETLs consuming from APIs
Experience working with Apache Parquet files
Experience with other ETL tooling like Airflow, Luigi, or similar
Experience working in agile and/or start-up environment
Good communication skills

Acerca del empleo
WHO YOU ARE
Hej! I‚Äôm Gonzalo de la Torre and I lead the Data & Analytics team within IKEA for Business, a global team of diverse and highly talented individuals in a quest to create the greatest possible IKEA experience for our business customers across the globe.

IKEA for Business is one of the fastest and most promising growth areas for us as a company. At the Data & Analytics team we have the goal to leverage data & Advanced Analytics to both drive business strategy, ensuring all key decisions to capture and sustain business value are data-driven, as well as to drive digital products development.
Our team within Data & Analytics and our Digital Hub is growing and we are currently looking for a Data Analyst with great business sense to join our Loyalty and Business customer engagement product area. This product team‚Äôs goal is to further develop and leverage our business customer internal and external data to create meaningful and engaging relationships while enhancing our digital marketing capabilities. If that sounds exciting to you and you recognize yourself in some of the following, we would love to talk with you!

1. Have a ‚Äúbalanced‚Äù profile: superior analytical, statistical and problem-solving skills but also good business judgement and a ‚Äúbiased for action and speed‚Äù entrepreneurial soul
2. Hold at least an MSc in a highly quantitative discipline with strong academic records e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, Econometrics or similar.
3. Have 3+ years of experience working in a fast-paced and hands-on-keyboard Advanced Analytics roles working with large and complex datasets e.g. Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Advanced Analytics consultant, or other relevant work
4. Enjoy translating imperfectly defined business problems into well-defined analytical problems, thinking which are the potential drivers of a problem (e.g. what factors predict customer lifetime value?) and finding out ways to acquire information (internal or external data sources) of those drivers/proxies to determine their actual contribution
5. Have broad experience driving digital product development with analytical insights e.g. creating and monitoring metrics, optimizing customer journeys, setting, running and analyzing experiments to test hypotheses and draw clear product recommendations
6. Have proficiency in creating dynamic and possibly real-time visualization, exploration tools, dashboards and maps to support decision making (e.g. strong PowerBI knowledge is greatly appreciated but Tableau/Data Studio/Looker/Qlikview is also valuable)
7. Love figuring out which analytical / ML methodologies to apply on data to quickly answer important business questions (e.g. which customer segments have more unmet potential?) using extensive knowledge of SQL, R/Python scripts, data wrangling, statistical and modeling libraries
8. Have experience making back of envelope business impact estimations of potential analytical solutions to inform development backlogs and you are fixated with securing ‚Äúvalue capture‚Äù by refining impact calculations as soon as an MVP is ready and continuously monitoring the impact once the solution is in production phase
9. Have a taste for presenting results with a clear and convincing storyline in a way that is easy to understand for both technical and non-technical stakeholders and that proves your points
10. Love to automate analysis, intelligence and models that drive value, collaborating with Data Engineers to bring them to production phase following the MLOPs framework
11. Are a great team player who takes ownership, loves to be ‚Äúfriendly challenged‚Äù and is comfortable friendly challenging team members from other job families as a way to collectively land on the best ideas as a team. You also love sharing knowledge and mentoring more junior members
12. Are a true optimist and proactive soul with a ‚Äúfounder mentality‚Äù i.e. you don‚Äôt get overwhelmed by uncertainty or wait to be told what to do but take ownership of the challenges and use your soft and hard analytical skills to get to solutions as a team.

This is our wish list! If you don‚Äôt recognize yourself in every one of these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We are looking for exceptional individuals and like to think long-term investing in people‚Äôs development together with us.

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it‚Äôs important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING DAY TO DAY
In this role, you‚Äôll lead the transformation of IKEA into a more data driven company by ensuring that data and insights are frequently and widely used in IKEA for Business in Group Digital to reinforce, alter, or largely impact present and future decisions on business and product strategy. For example, we are developing models, dashboards and tools to answer questions like:

‚Ä¢ Who are our business customers? What do they need? How do they buy? How can we build a data-driven segmentation and distinguish different customer profiles? Which segments have more growth potential and why aren‚Äôt we currently realizing that potential?
‚Ä¢ How can we estimate the business customer life-time or ‚Äúnext 5 years‚Äù value upon registration? And after the first purchase? What is their stage in their lifecycle? When will they buy again? Can we predict their purchase patterns?
‚Ä¢ Which variables could we use to create meaningful target audiences? How can we measure a campaign effectiveness?
‚Ä¢ How can we estimate the impact of our current loyalty club e.g. how does the lifetime value of our clients increase after using our loyalty club? Which benefits imply a bigger LTV increase? What other benefits could we develop and what‚Äôs the fastest way to test the impact of these benefits?
‚Ä¢ What is the price-sensitivity of our clients for a given product or service? Can we optimize IKEA pricing and discount strategies?
‚Ä¢ How do our business customers use IKEA digital platforms? How do they interact between different channels? Which is their engagement? Can we detect the bottlenecks in the funnel and their root causes?
‚Ä¢ Who are the customers most prone to buy a given product? What is the most suitable product to offer each customer?
‚Ä¢ Which business customers are more prone to leave IKEA (not to purchase again)? What are the main drivers of churn? Which levers should we pull to increase loyalty? What are the main drivers of NPS?

OUR TEAM WITHIN IKEA
You will work in Data & Analytics together with other highly talented Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Stewards and Data Architects. Together you will be joining cross-functional teams consisting of colleagues from Technology, Product and Design from IKEA for Business. All of you together will be creating the best solutions to create better experience for our many Business customers.

The home office for this role will be Madrid within our new Digital Hub, but we act as one global team and work together on global solutions.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

‚Ä¢ An intellectually stimulating, diverse and open atmosphere, working on really interesting and often surprisingly hard problems as described above and where you can be yourself
‚Ä¢ The opportunity to collaborate with a team of highly talented colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects of Data & Analytics) along with other exceptional colleagues from product owners to product engineers or designers. Moreover, you are encouraged to collaborate with other Data & Analytics colleagues in other specialist teams
‚Ä¢ The opportunity to create real and measurable global impact participating in the definition, growth and performance optimization of Ikea for Business. Most things remain to be done so it‚Äôs the perfect time to join.
‚Ä¢ Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open-source tools across the board
‚Ä¢ Hardware and Operating System your choice
‚Ä¢ Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning)
‚Ä¢ Flexible and friendly working environment in a truly value-based company

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!
Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world‚Äôs leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.

If you have questions regarding the recruitment system, please reach out to Georgia Toonley at georgia.tooley@ingka.com

Please apply with your application in English else we will not be able to process your application.

Please apply with CV and cover letter stating who you are and why do you think you would be a great fit for the role and IKEA. Note that we can‚Äôt process any applications through email. Thank you!

Curiosity: You should always be curious to ask the ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù questions from the business and ‚Äúhow‚Äù from the development team

What we offer at Keyrus:

Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Acerca del empleo
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Veeva Link seeks a mid to senior Python Data Engineer that will participate in all aspects of architecting and developing new and innovative data pipelines and data handling. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing. This is a great opportunity for an engineer looking to expand their well-established career, who is excited about search, solving complex problems, ownership, and who enjoys working with technologies like Python, ElasticSearch, and AWS.

You must be based in Spain and be eligible for employment within the EU, as Veeva does not sponsor employment visa processes for this role.

What You'll Do

Participate in architecting and extending our data pipelines to accommodate the rising data amounts
Collect data e.g., publications from doctors, meant for our production systems from several internal sources into a stable data set
Make the data consumable for other teams using the right databases (e.g., ElasticSearch or Postgres) and APIs

Requirements

5+ years of working as a software or data engineer
Very good Python knowledge with one widely used framework like Django, FastAPI, or Flask
Very good knowledge of one widely used RDS like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL, or Oracle
Good ElasticSearch and Git knowledge
Excellent verbal and written communication in English

Nice to Have

Knowledge in data streaming, AWS, REST APIs and GraphQL

#RemoteSpain Veeva‚Äôs headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Acerca del empleo
From ASTEK Iberia, we are looking for a Data Analyst to work with our partner leader in B2B IT Travel.

You would be contributing to the 'Performance Measurement & Reporting'' area of Internal IT.

Responsibilities

If you are interested and want more information about the position, please contact to abernard@astek.es, enclosing a CV detailed in english

Acerca del empleo
Hej! We‚Äôre expanding our Digital Hub and I‚Äôm looking for engineers to join our new Digital Food Experience area.

Our teams are growing and looking for new engineers looking into new challenges to create a better everyday life for the many people where Food is an integral part of how we can achieve that goal.

At IKEA, you‚Äôre welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don‚Äôt even care how you have furnished your home. We‚Äôre interested in you simply because you‚Äôre you. Our different views, backgrounds, and personalities make us better understand our customers, give us more fun at work and spark more and better ideas. Perhaps your unique take on something could lead to a great idea that creates a better everyday life for the many people.


IKEA FOOD

In-store restaurants, coffee-corners, bistros or Swedish markets are part of the Ikea food journey driving the food services to one of the most recognized Ikea experiences engaging thousands of customers around the world.

We have the challenge to empower and innovate the digital experience for the many people - internal and external users ‚Äì making their everyday life better thanks to technology. Among others, you will work on software solutions to:

- Create new online experiences
- Boost the in-store journey
- Improve logistic efficiency
- Have efficient food services operations
- Reduce waste, contributing to a sustainable planet

We have a wide focus in more than 400 stores. Our environment is completely international where English is the main language having digital hubs spread across the world. You will have colleagues in many cities like Amsterdam, Malm√∂ or Philadelphia.


OUR LANDSCAPE

We don‚Äôt have a closed technical stack because we like to favour the use of the most modern tools and languages when picking the most appropriate tool for the job. Currently we are primarily using:

- Cloud infrastructure (mainly GCP), handled with Terraform to remain provider agnostic.
- TypeScript, Java, Python, Golang.
- React, Vue.js

We adapt our stack to the best suitable solution. All our developments focus on high quality standards. We love to follow principles like CI/CD, monitoring and testing automation. Also, we love to apply trending approaches like event driven systems, API firsts, or hexagonal architecture.

We believe in cross-functional devops teams so your team and yourself as a team member will be responsible for of all technical aspects of the products during its lifetime; including design, development, deployment, evolution and maintenance.


ABOUT YOU

As a hands-on Software Engineer, you will consistently have opportunities to work closely with other Software Engineers as part of an agile team. We expect you to:

‚Ä¢ Have a strong technical background that allows you to contribute shaping the technical direction of your team, while consistently delivering production-ready code.
‚Ä¢ Know how to balance technical best practices and pragmatism.
‚Ä¢ Be able to design, deliver and maintain working software.
‚Ä¢ Have an agile mindset focusing on the end-user in an iteratively and incremental manner.
‚Ä¢ Be proactive and responsible of your team solutions.


ABOUT THIS WORK AREA

Food Digital is a relatively new area, with most still to be done. You‚Äôll be joining a product squad to work in an agile environment. While part of a huge ecosystem, in Food Digital we own our solutions. That means that the team is responsible for the whole journey of the product; from design, picking the most suitable technology, to implementing an appropriate observability system. You‚Äôll be working closely with product as one team, and be part of an amazing community of engineers that all share a quality driven mentality. You will also have ownership over your career plan, deciding in which direction you want to grow. Your manager will support and advice in your journey, and all engineers have access to any learning platform necessary (like Pluralsight).

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it‚Äôs important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding those and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com or just watch this movie: https://vimeo.com/290339889.
Most things remain to be done. And that‚Äôs why we want you to help us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don‚Äôt apply for jobs unless they‚Äôre 100% ‚Äúqualified‚Äù. If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application. (From: ‚ÄúWhy Women Don‚Äôt Apply for Jobs Unless They‚Äôre 100% Qualified‚Äù by Tara Sophia Mohr, August 2014‚Äù)

Acerca del empleo
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Veeva Link seeks a mid to senior Python Data Engineer that will participate in all aspects of architecting and developing new and innovative data pipelines and data handling. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing. This is a great opportunity for an engineer looking to expand their well-established career, who is excited about search, solving complex problems, ownership, and who enjoys working with technologies like Python, ElasticSearch, and AWS.

You must be based in Spain and be eligible for employment within the EU, as Veeva does not sponsor employment visa processes for this role.

What You'll Do

Participate in architecting and extending our data pipelines to accommodate the rising data amounts
Collect data e.g., publications from doctors, meant for our production systems from several internal sources into a stable data set
Make the data consumable for other teams using the right databases (e.g., ElasticSearch or Postgres) and APIs

Requirements

5+ years of working as a software or data engineer
Very good Python knowledge with one widely used framework like Django, FastAPI, or Flask
Very good knowledge of one widely used RDS like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL, or Oracle
Good ElasticSearch and Git knowledge
Excellent verbal and written communication in English

Nice to Have

Knowledge in data streaming, AWS, REST APIs and GraphQL

#RemoteSpain Veeva‚Äôs headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Acerca del empleo
Job Description

Buscamos gente como t√∫: ¬°Que disfrutas de tu trabajo, aceptas retos para llegar m√°s lejos en tu carrera, te sientes orgulloso de pertenecer a una compa√±√≠a Top Employer, te gusta el trabajo en equipo y colaborar con tu experiencia para que todos seamos mejores en nuestro d√≠a a d√≠a!

¬øQuieres recibir formaci√≥n en √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as y tener la posibilidad de certificarte de manera gratuita?

¬øQuieres trabajar en un ambiente din√°mico, con proyectos de gran envergadura aplicando tecnolog√≠a de √∫ltima generaci√≥n y trabajar en equipo con profesionales de primer nivel?

Buscamos en cualquier localizaci√≥n a varios Consultores Power BI , apasionados por los datos en todas sus formas y procesos. Extracci√≥n, transformaci√≥n, procesamiento y visualizaci√≥n.

Imprescindible

Experiencia en entornos empresariales complejos y con grandes volumetr√≠as de datos

Interlocuci√≥n con √°reas de negocio
Comunicaci√≥n en ingl√©s

Deseable

Experiencia usando PowerBI en escenarios de tiempo real/streaming
Conocimiento de otras herramientas de la Power Platform (PowerAutomate, PowerApps)
Experiencia en plataformas de Datos cloud (Snowflake, Azure Synapse,..)

¬øQu√© beneficios ofrecemos en Avanade?

Horario que te permitir√° conciliar vida laboral y personal.
Participaci√≥n en proyectos importantes para clientes de primer nivel nacional e internacional.

Puedes revisar la lista completa de beneficios en el siguiente enlace: benefits-spain.pdf (avanade.com)

¬øEst√°s interesado? ¬°Inscr√≠bete ahora!

Te esperamos ¬°Avanade es tu compa√±√≠a!

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft‚Äôs Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Acerca del empleo
About us
RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. RavenPack‚Äôs products allow clients to enhance returns, reduce risk and increase efficiency by systematically incorporating the effects of public information in their models or workflows. Our clients include the most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers in the world. We're privately funded and VC backed, and our recent Series B round raised $10 million.
Ravenpack has 15TB of textual data available in an archive stretching back 20 years. That means hundreds of billions of richly annotated sentences that are waiting to be used for innovative ML projects. If you are excited by the opportunity to work with a world class technical team to deliver game changing ML products then we want to talk to you.


About the project:
You‚Äôll be a part of an innovative financial search application using the latest technologies in machine learning to improve diversification, personalization, and many others. We are working with the latest technologies in Transformers and Deep Learning for text. Also, you will be part of designing new POCs that become ML solutions for the company.


About the team:
The ML team at Ravenpack is a group of 3 talented remote engineers that work passionately with Natural Language Processing and the latest advances in Deep Learning. As full stack ML Engineers, we are in charge of defining the entire cycle from data cleaning to model training finishing with the deployment and building of the MLOPs pipeline.


First month
The onboarding process starts... You will be having scheduled meetings with the main stakeholders of the different teams in order to get an overall understanding of all company products and specifically focus on the projects you will be working on. You will start participating in the scrum ceremonies and also you will work on a project from scratch with the support of the ML team.


After 3 months
Now you have a plan on how to solve the project. You will train your models and you will deploy them to test in the development stage. You will participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation. You will communicate progress and results with stakeholders and other members of the team.


6 months in
Now, you have likely gained a significant amount of experience and knowledge in the field. Some tasks and responsibilities you may be expected to perform include:
Actively participating in the research and development of new Machine Learning models.
Continuously optimizing and improving the performance of existing models.
Building and deploying Machine Learning pipelines and models in production environments, and working with other members of the team to integrate them into real-world applications.
Collaborating with other teams and departments, such as Data Science, Software Engineering, and Product Management, to ensure that the Machine Learning models are meeting the needs of the business.
Staying up to date with the latest developments and advances in the field of Machine Learning, and experimenting with new techniques and tools to improve the performance of your models.
Communicating progress and results with stakeholders, including executives and other members of the organization.


Requirements:
BSc/BA in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience.
Programming experience (we mainly work with Python) to obtain, manipulate, and analyze data.
Build, deploy and maintain Machine Learning (we mainly use sklearn) and Deep Learning (we mainly use TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugginface) models to solve specific business problems like ranking, classification, or representation learning
Experience building data products from POC to production.
Experience understanding search platforms, how to do efficient queries, ranking results and evaluate the quality of the system.
Capacity for handling uncertainty and balancing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Desirable
MLOPs pipelines and best practices
Data-centric approach
Data engineering skills

Benefits:
We have a Lab day, basically one day each sprint to investigate whatever field is fascinating to you. You want to try something new or a crazy idea with our data. Do it on this day.
We receive continuous support and training on the latest ML technologies (i.e. MLOPs, Search and ranking, recommendations, and many others)
Each week we have 1 hour to do our Takumi session. The objective of this session is to learn something new from your colleagues. Thanks to this Takumi session we learn new things, for example about graph neural networks and how to use pre-trained models to generate training samples‚Ä¶

What's in it for you
You will work with the latest technologies.
Our Headquarter is located in Marbella. We are offering Hybrid work.
Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, la Riviera and Estepona.
You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
